alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Allegany (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 11:49AM EST until November 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Wintry mix expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations around a coating to one inch below 1000 feet, and 1 to 3 inches above 1000 feet. Total ice accumulations around a trace up to a tenth of an inch, mainly above 1000 feet. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, northwest Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. A wintry mix will end as rain tonight, but rain will freeze on elevated surfaces above 1000 feet. A period of moderate to perhaps heavy snow is possible between 4 and 7 PM around Cumberland toward Flintstone. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will be reduced to under 1 mile at times in a wintry mix as well as fog for the ridges above 1000 feet. Snowfall rates up to an inch per hour are possible late this afternoon and early evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
